channel.description:
No body else posted theirs, so I'll post mine.
Only 5 fields away from beating Quaters ;)
Also, some of you may question the complete lunacy that is the structure of my output.
You see, I have changed the back-end engine of my updater. Each "category" of fields now runs in it's own thread, adding the correct output into a string builder as it goes. Now, originally this caused massive lag, so I am currently "reusing" a total of 5 threads. Anyhow, this means that each "category" of fields is printed simultaneously, but in a random order. I have tried to group like fields together though. It does however pose large speed improvements over other updaters that I have seen.
[code]Running The Bank's RS Updater
The Client Revision is #512
[ StringWrapper ] *~* getBytes : byte[] hj.eb *~* getLength : int hj.K *~* isEditable : boolean hj.ib *~* getHash : int hj.ob
[ LoginIndex ] *~* getLoginIndex : int ch.t
[ SettingArray ] *~* getSettingArray : int[] tk.Hb
[ Player ] *~* getPlayerIndexArray : int[] ok.Yb *~* getPlayerArray : th[] f.j *~* getPlayerCount : int uh.Q
[ PlayerDef ] *~* getName : hj th.dc *~* getModel : sf th.Sb *~* getCurrentOffset : int fh.lb *~* getPkHeadIcon : short th.Ec *~* getPrayerHeadIcon : short th.Gc *~* getTeam : short th.Gc *~* getLevel : int th.Ic
[ Interface ] *~* getCache : tk[] tk.rc *~* getToolTip : hj tk.tc *~* getSpellName : hj tk.Eb *~* getValueIndexArray : int[][] tk.e *~* isInventoryInterface : boolean tk.mc *~* getInvSpritePadX : int tk.gc *~* getInvSpritePadY : int tk.Pc *~* getActions : hj[] tk.nc *~* getText : hj tk.w *~* getTextColour : int tk.oc *~* getHeight : int tk.m *~* getWidth : int tk.Qc *~* getActionType : int tk.Gc *~* getType : int tk.bd *~* getInventory : int[] tk.uc *~* getBackgroundColor : int tk.Tc *~* getInterfaceSelectedModelID : int tk.Bc *~* getInterfaceSelectedModelType : int tk.z *~* getNotInterfaceSelectedModelID : int tk.fd *~* getNotInterfaceSelectedModelType : int tk.k *~* getInventoryStackSizes : int[] tk.lb *~* getSelectedActionName : hj tk.zc *~* getMasterX : int tk.masterX *~* getMasterY : int tk.masterY
[ InterfaceXY ] *~* getX : int tk.S *~* getY : int tk.n
[ ValidInterfaceArray ] *~* getValidInterfaceArray : boolean[] gj.f
[ SignLink ] *~* getGameApplet : java.applet.Applet sd.m *~* getEventQueue : java.awt.EventQueue sd.j *~* getCurrentUsername : hj hi.l *~* getCurrentPassword : hj hi.h
[ Minimap ] *~* getMinimapInt1 : int client.lb *~* getMinimapInt2 : int ag.W *~* getMinimapInt3 : int oc.u *~* getCURVESIN : int[] je.q *~* getCURVECOS : int[] je.b
[ Skills ] *~* getSkillLevelMaxes : int[] ck.C *~* getSkillLevels : int[] ag.S *~* getSkillExperiences : int[] oe.T
[ SkillExperiencesMax ] *~* getSkillExperiencesMax : int[] uj.cb

[ CachedItem ] *~* getItem : sa le.E
[ Character ] *~* getX : int kk.r *~* getY : int kk.L *~* getAnimation : int kk.Q *~* isMoving : int kk.bb *~* getMessage : hj kk.v
[ Entity ] *~* getPublicChatMode : int lb.i *~* getHPRatio : int kk.mb *~* getLoopCycle : int da.O *~* getLoopCycleStatus : int kk.wb *~* getHeight : int kk.s
[ InteractingEntity ] *~* getInteracting : int kk.fb *~* getSelfInteracting : int lg.h *~* getTurnDirection : int kk.Gb
[ Camera ] *~* getCamPosX : int ob.c *~* getCamPosY : int pb.l *~* getCamPosZ : int na.j *~* getPlane : int nh.F
[ CameraCurves ] *~* getCameraCurveX : int ba.j *~* getCameraCurveY : int mh.l
[ GroundByteArray ] *~* getGroundByteArray : byte[][][] he.f
[ GroundIntArray ] *~* getGroundIntArray : int[][][] pf.c

[ Mouse ] *~* getMousePressX : int gh.hb *~* getMousePressTime : long jf.Wb *~* getMousePressY : int qb.Y *~* getMousePressLastButton : int jf.sb *~* getMousePressButton : int ph.f *~* getMouseX : int fa.f *~* getMouseY : int od.j
[ Node ] *~* getID : long bb.p *~* getNext : bb bb.g *~* getPrevious : bb bb.h
[ NodeList ] *~* getNodeListArray : ka[][][] ie.Q *~* getHead : bb ka.i *~* getCurrent : bb ka.v
[ Chat ] *~* getChatMessages : hj[] o.o *~* getChatTypes : int[] dj.b *~* getChatNames : hj[] eb.C
[ Menu ] *~* getMenuOptionsCount : int ed.b *~* getMenuX : int qk.L *~* getMenuY : int a.d *~* isMenuOpen : boolean c.z

[ NodeClasses ] *~* getObjectDefMRUNodes : ta te.C *~* getItemDefMRUNodes : ta tf.p *~* getList : ci ta.c *~* getInitialCount : int ta.m *~* getSpaceLeft : int ta.g *~* getNodeCache : c ta.p *~* getCache : bb[] c.l *~* getCertTemplateID : int ef.w *~* getCertID : int ef.w *~* getID : int ef.o *~* getActions : hj[] ef.L *~* getTeam : int ef.gb *~* isMembers : boolean fd.r *~* isMembersObject : boolean ef.g
[ Objects ] *~* getGroundArray : rg[][][] sg.c *~* getObject1 : fc rg.D *~* getObject2 : re rg.S *~* getObject3 : ge rg.V *~* getObject4 : pa rg.G *~* getObject5Array : jd[] rg.E *~* getUID : long ge.i *~* getUID : long jd.l *~* getUID : long fc.m *~* getUID : long pa.i *~* getUID : long re.f
[ NPC ] *~* getNPCIndexArray : int[] mi.M *~* getNPCArray : ok[] ac.a *~* getNPCDef : vi ok.Qb *~* getNPCCount : int a.a
[ NPCDef ] *~* getName : hj vi.E *~* getActions : hj[] vi.ab *~* getType : int vi.fb
[ DrawMinimap ] *~* getMinimapSprite : qb ce.s *~* getMapDots : qb[] ke.a *~* getFriendNodeIDs : int[] vj.lb *~* getFriendCount : int li.Q *~* getDestX : int mk.d *~* getDestY : int dd.X *~* getMapMarkers : qb[] vb.t
[ CanReach ] *~* getCost : int[][] uh.W *~* getVia : int[][] le.F *~* getBlocks : int[][] ah.a *~* getGroundDataArray : ah[] eh.b
[ Sprite ] *~* getPixels : int[] kc.M *~* getWidth : int qb.S *~* getHeight : int qb.G
Loading Interfaces... * class hj implements class RSString * class ok implements class NPC * class vi implements class NPCDef * class th implements class Player * class sf implements class Model * class ed implements class Animable * class fh implements class Stream * class kk implements class Character * class tk implements class Interface * class sa implements class Item * class rg implements class Ground * class ge implements class ObjectDefinition * class jd implements class ObjectDefinition * class fc implements class ObjectDefinition * class pa implements class ObjectDefinition * class re implements class ObjectDefinition * class ti implements class NodeSub * class bb implements class Node * class ka implements class NodeList * class le implements class CachedItem * class fg implements class ObjectDef * class ef implements class ItemDef * class ta implements class MRUNodes * class ci implements class NodeSubList * class c implements class NodeCache * class kc implements class Sprite * class ah implements class GroundData
Hooked 174 fields! Defined 27 classes! Update Took 6 seconds. [/code]
[i]EDIT1: Added generic interfaces[/i]

item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

They’d better spend their money on more English servers, then on servers that only 5% of the players can use.

5 German worlds against 159 English worlds. That’s 3%, so still don’t get the problem. Since they now have a huger market then they did before.
German/French people hardly speak English, that’s why you see much more Dutch players, because they can speak English.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

Yz85Racer:

Semi-offtopic: What current languages do Runescape support? English and German?

Officially only those, but a third translation method is already implemented but still filed with German words.
That means that French will be added very soon (well the client side…)

Read full topic

item.description:

yes right now, but they are hiring people that know spanish and french on their website.

item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:31, topic:235176”]But still my point stands that it’s a pathic design. At least after deobfuscation.
Certainly for a game as runescape that takes a lot of memory. You keep 3 languages in memory while you only use one.[/quote]it isnt that bad, once they get more languages they will probably put the strings into the data files

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:30, topic:235176”][code]
…
String idiot_EN = “How are you so dumb?”;
String idiot_DE = “Wie sind Sie so dumm?”;
String idiot_FR = “Comment êtes-vous si stupides?”;

String idiot = idiot_EN;
…
void translate() {
if (lang == LANG_DE) {
…
idiot = idiot_DE;
…
} else if (lang == LANG_FR) {
…
idiot = idiot_FR;
…
}
}
[/code]
i dont think you really understand anything, the fact that the initialisation field is private only means that it cannot be translated back.

it isnt a method of obfuscation, merely a design decision that has been obfuscated[/quote]
I was wrong about it being a method of obfuscation, because I didn’t check multiple string the first time.

I didn’t really see it as a refference the first time, cause the refference basicly becomes the only English field in the client.
But still my point stands that it’s a pathic design. At least after deobfuscation.
Certainly for a game as runescape that takes a lot of memory. You keep 3 languages in memory while you only use one.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

...
String idiot_EN = "How are you so dumb?";
String idiot_DE = "Wie sind Sie so dumm?";
String idiot_FR = "Comment êtes-vous si stupides?";

String idiot = idiot_EN;
...
void translate() {
  if (lang == LANG_DE) {
    ...
    idiot = idiot_DE;
    ...
  } else if (lang == LANG_FR) {
    ...
    idiot = idiot_FR;
    ...
   }
}

i dont think you really understand anything, the fact that the initialisation field is private only means that it cannot be translated back.

it isnt a method of obfuscation, merely a design decision that has been obfuscated

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:27, topic:235176”][quote author=qauters link=topic=310144.msg2478626#msg2478626 date=1223411206]
When going to the translate methods you will see things like this:

pd.nb = qf.c;
rh.o = nb.V;
mg.gb = lk.j;
dc.p = jc.V;

The fields on the left are English and the fields on the right are translations.

So, what the hell are you on about?
[/quote]you the the most retarded faggot i have ever seen

the reference that is use is initialised with the english values[/quote]

one field is the english string, another will be the german string, the other will be the reference to whatever language is currently active
As said before, because the English fields are assigned to a private variable which isn't accessed ever, the reference becomes the English field. This means what you call English fields, can't be called that because they virtually don't exists. You can't translate from German to English, because you can't access it. 
private static RSString a = "Walk here";
static RSString b= a;

is practically the same as:

static RSString b = "Walk here";

Jeez, I thought you would be smart enough to understand that…
The only reason they do it like this, would be to possible in the future support a language change while running. Cause they only need to remove the private access flags then.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:25, topic:235176”][quote author=nueb35 link=topic=310144.msg2478328#msg2478328 date=1223399196]
simple guess but that would make it take up less memory correct? if so. im gonna implement it into my updater :0
[/quote]the amount of memory saved would be negligible

qauters, one field is the english string, another will be the german string, the other will be the reference to whatever language is currently active. what the hell are you on about?[/quote]
frank_, you are making a fool of yourself. If you say things without actually looking at the client.

if(args[5].equals("english"))
{
   currentLanguage = 0;
}
else if(args[5].equals("german"))
{
   currentLanguage = 1;
}
...
translateClient(currentLanguage);

the translateClient method:

static final void translateClient(int language)
{
   mc_translateClient++; //method counter
   if(language != 0)
   {
      if(language != 1)
      {
         if(language != 2)
            throw new RuntimeException();
         else
            translateToFrench(); //uses German translation text currently!!!
      } else
         translateToGerman();
   }
}

When going to the translate methods you will see things like this:

pd.nb = qf.c;
rh.o = nb.V;
mg.gb = lk.j;
dc.p = jc.V;

The fields on the left are English and the fields on the right are translations.

So, what the hell are you on about?

Read full topic

[quote=“nueb35, post:23, topic:235176”]simple guess but that would make it take up less memory correct? if so. im gonna implement it into my updater :0[/quote]the amount of memory saved would be negligible

qauters, one field is the english string, another will be the german string, the other will be the reference to whatever language is currently active. what the hell are you on about?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“nueb35, post:21, topic:235176”][quote author=qauters link=topic=310144.msg2478293#msg2478293 date=1223398126]

you also have reinitializing of values (private RSString a = defineRSString(“Test”); RSString b = a;)
[/quote]no, that serves a purpose, have you looked how multiple languages are implemented? obviously not

You obviously don’t have a clue where I’m talking about.

private static e j;
static e d;

 static 
 {
     j = jh.a("Choose Option", 2047);
     d = j;
 }

j is only accessed once more, which is j = null;

You just talk about the translation method translateToGerman()
There is a second method which currently translates to German as well, but that will be changed to French (most likely) in a few weeks.
You have to set language to 2 (0 = English, 1 = German) to get that.

As you can see, I do know where I talk about. Don’t treat me like I’m a complete idiot.

could it be posible to make an updater delete these middle man fields and simply change the PUTSTATIC so that it sets the real field?[/quote]
Yes, you can. Just to a simple search in every method for this:

getstatic e le.j 
putstatic e le.d

and fix it (remove the j = null as well)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:17, topic:235176”][quote author=qauters link=topic=310144.msg2478072#msg2478072 date=1223382108]

[quote author=Cheese_Police link=topic=310144.msg2477502#msg2477502 date=1223335940]

I mean, if your friend lives at house nr. 19, you will look for that number. You won’t enter every house, to see if your friend’s in it, do you?
[/quote]if your friend has a habit of going to arbitrary houses instead of his own, yes.

Which is kind of what the obfuscation does. gr8 analogy

The obfuscation only performs an xor on values, increases shift sizes, breaks the control flow, mixes static methods and adds fake arguments.
Could you tell me, why that would hide a big ass double? Since you just search for it and it’s xor version.
Or you search for a field reference etc, you don’t loop all methods to do so.

As for the arbitary houses thing… its not really accurate as you are looking for a house painted yellow with a strange antenna sticking out the top and only 3 windows.

Sometimes you do yes, but that’s always faster then having to search every house. Incase of static methods, you sometimes have to loop every method.

I checked my big hooks and the uid hack loops every method searching for a patern. But that is because it has to hack that method, and you can’t have a different pattern for it.
[/quote]stop making excuses for being bad

ps 999 more techniques used for the obfuscation[/quote]
If you don’t give constructive criticism, don’t give critic at all.
I’m open for tips, not for useless statements.

Ps. Not that many, you also have reinitializing of values (private RSString a = defineRSString(“Test”); RSString b = a;), adding of method counters, renaming, adding of useless code fragments (int i = arg0 / 2 + 3;), without ever calling it. Might forgot a few, but not many.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:16, topic:235176”][quote author=Cheese_Police link=topic=310144.msg2477502#msg2477502 date=1223335940]

I mean, if your friend lives at house nr. 19, you will look for that number. You won’t enter every house, to see if your friend’s in it, do you?
[/quote]if your friend has a habit of going to arbitrary houses instead of his own, yes.

Which is kind of what the obfuscation does. gr8 analogy

The obfuscation only performs an xor on values, increases shift sizes, breaks the control flow, mixes static methods and adds fake arguments.
Could you tell me, why that would hide a big ass double? Since you just search for it and it’s xor version.
Or you search for a field reference etc, you don’t loop all methods to do so.

As for the arbitary houses thing… its not really accurate as you are looking for a house painted yellow with a strange antenna sticking out the top and only 3 windows.

Sometimes you do yes, but that’s always faster then having to search every house. Incase of static methods, you sometimes have to loop every method.

I checked my big hooks and the uid hack loops every method searching for a patern. But that is because it has to hack that method, and you can’t have a different pattern for it.[/quote]stop making excuses for being bad

ps 999 more techniques used for the obfuscation

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:14, topic:235176”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=310144.msg2477415#msg2477415 date=1223333558]

I mean, if your friend lives at house nr. 19, you will look for that number. You won’t enter every house, to see if your friend’s in it, do you?
[/quote]if your friend has a habit of going to arbitrary houses instead of his own, yes.

Which is kind of what the obfuscation does. gr8 analogy[/quote]
The obfuscation only performs an xor on values, increases shift sizes, breaks the control flow, mixes static methods and adds fake arguments.
Could you tell me, why that would hide a big ass double? Since you just search for it and it’s xor version.
Or you search for a field reference etc, you don’t loop all methods to do so.

As for the arbitary houses thing... its not really accurate as you are looking for a house painted yellow with a strange antenna sticking out the top and only 3 windows.
Sometimes you do yes, but that's always faster then having to search every house. Incase of static methods, you sometimes have to loop every method.

I checked my big hooks and the uid hack loops every method searching for a patern. But that is because it has to hack that method, and you can’t have a different pattern for it.

Read full topic
